answer_html: Because A is a linear transformation from \(\mathbb{R}^5\), and the dimension of the column space of A is 3, we conclude that the dimension of the kernel is 2.
answer_latex:
Because \emph{A} is a linear
transformation from $\mathbb{R}^5$, and the dimension of the column
space of \emph{A} is 3, we conclude that the dimension of the kernel is
2.
hints_html: Think of the matrix A as a linear transformation from \(\mathbb{R}^5 \rightarrow \mathbb{R}^4\).
hints_latex:
Think of the matrix \emph{A} as a linear transformation from
$\mathbb{R}^5 \rightarrow \mathbb{R}^4$.
hints_raw: Think of the matrix ''A'' as a linear transformation from <math>\mathbb{R}^5 \rightarrow \mathbb{R}^4</math>.
question: 8 (b)
sols_html: By the rank-nullity theorem, we know that dim(\(\mathbb{R}^5\)) = dim(column space) + dim(kernel). Because A is a linear transformation from \(\mathbb{R}^5\), and the dimension of the column space of A is 3, we conclude that the dimension of the kernel is 2.
sols_latex:
By the rank-nullity theorem, we know that dim($\mathbb{R}^5$) =
dim(column space) + dim(kernel). Because \emph{A} is a linear
transformation from $\mathbb{R}^5$, and the dimension of the column
space of \emph{A} is 3, we conclude that the dimension of the kernel is
2.
sols_raw: By the rank-nullity theorem, we know that dim(<math>\mathbb{R}^5</math>) = dim(column space) + dim(kernel).  Because ''A'' is a linear transformation from <math>\mathbb{R}^5</math>, and the dimension of the column space of ''A'' is 3, we conclude that the dimension of the kernel is 2.
statement_html:
Consider the matrix

\[\begin{aligned} A = \left(\begin{array}{ccccc} 1 & 0 & -1 & 2 & 4 \\ 0 & 1 & -2 & 0 & -1 \\ -1 & -2 & 5 & 1 & 4 \\ 1 & 0 & -1 & 1 & 2 \end{array}\right)\end{aligned}\]

b) Find the dimension of the nullspace of A.
statement_raw:
Consider the matrix

:<math>
A = \left(\begin{array}{ccccc}
1 & 0 & -1 & 2 & 4 \\
0 & 1 & -2 & 0 & -1 \\
-1 & -2 & 5 & 1 & 4 \\
1 & 0 & -1 & 1 & 2
\end{array}\right)
</math>

'''b)''' Find the dimension of the nullspace of ''A''.
